SlotMap.summary: Represents a collection that maps to values of type .
SlotMap.typeparam: The type of values stored in the map.

remarks.para: The class provides a collection that associates keys of type with values of type . It is designed to efficiently manage and access values by their associated keys while allowing for easy addition and removal of entries.
This collection can grow dynamically as elements are added and it manages its internal memory allocation to optimize performance.

Ctor1.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an empty collection.
Ctor1.remarks: Use this constructor to create a new with no elements initially. The will be empty, and its internal storage will be an empty array.

Ctor2.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified capacity.
Ctor2.param: The initial capacity of the . Must be a non-negative integer.
Ctor2.remarks: Use this constructor to create a new with a specific initial capacity. The parameter determines the maximum number of elements the can hold before resizing its internal storage.

Capacity.remarks: The capacity represents the maximum number of elements that the can hold before it needs to resize its internal storage.

Count.summary: Gets the number of elements currently stored in the .

IsEmpty.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the is empty.
IsEmpty.remarks: The IsEmpty property returns if the contains no elements, and otherwise.

Keys.summary: Gets a collection containing the keys in the .
Keys.remarks: Only the keys that correspond to occupied slots are included in this collection. You can use this collection to iterate through the keys associated with the values in the map.
Keys.returns: A containing the keys in the .

Values.summary: Gets a collection containing the values in the .
Values.remarks: Only the values that correspond to occupied slots are included in this collection. You can use this collection to iterate through the values associated with the keys in the map.
Values.returns: A containing the values in the .

Indexer.summary: Gets or sets the value associated with the specified .
Indexer.param: The for which to get or set the associated value.
Indexer.value: The value associated with the specified .
Indexer.exception: Thrown if the is not found in the .
Indexer.remarks: Use this indexer to access the value associated with a specific in the . If the is not found in the map during the get operation, a KeyNotFoundException is thrown. To set the value associated with a , assign a new value to this indexer.

Add.summary: Adds a value to the and returns the associated .
Add.param: The value to be added to the . Must not be null.

remarks.para: The Add method adds the specified to the . It assigns the value to an available slot if one is available; otherwise, it expands the internal storage to accommodate the new value.
The parameter must not be null; otherwise, an is thrown.

Add.returns: The associated with the added value.

ContainsKey.summary: Determines whether the contains the specified .
ContainsKey.param: The to check for existence in the .
ContainsKey.remarks: Use this method to check if a specific exists in the . A is considered to exist if its is within the valid range of slots (0 to the capacity of the map) and the corresponding slot has the same version as the provided .
ContainsKey.returns: if the contains the specified and the associated slot has the same version; otherwise, .

ContainsValue.summary: Determines whether the contains a specific value.
ContainsValue.param: The value to locate in the .
ContainsValue.remarks: The ContainsValue method searches the for the presence of a specified value. If the value is found and is not , the method returns . If the value is or not found in the , the method returns .
ContainsValue.returns: if the contains an element with the specified value; otherwise, .

Clear.remarks: The Clear method removes all elements from the , resetting it to an empty state. It also resets the internal counters and clears the values stored in the , but it does not deallocate memory. Use this method to clear the when you want to reuse it without resizing its internal storage.

Drain.summary: Removes and returns elements from the one at a time as an enumerable collection of key-value pairs.
Drain.remarks: The Drain method iterates through the elements in the , removes each element one at a time, and yields them as key-value pairs. Each key-value pair consists of a and its associated value.
Drain.returns: An of containing the entries retrieved from the secondary map.

EnsureCapacity.summary: Ensures that the can hold at least the specified capacity without resizing.
EnsureCapacity.param: The desired capacity. Must be a non-negative integer.
EnsureCapacity.remarks: Use this method to ensure that the can hold at least the specified without resizing its internal storage. If the current capacity is less than the specified , the method will resize the internal storage to meet or exceed the desired capacity.
EnsureCapacity.returns: The capacity of the after ensuring it can accommodate the specified capacity. If the current capacity is already greater than or equal to the specified capacity, the current capacity is returned.

Get.summary: Gets the value associated with the specified .
Get.param: The to look up in the .
Get.remarks: Use this method to retrieve the value associated with a specific in the . If the is not found in the map, a is thrown.
Get.exception: Thrown if the specified is not found in the map.

Insert.summary: Inserts a value into the associated with the specified .
Insert.param: The key at which to insert the value.
The value to insert into the .
Insert.remarks: Use the Insert method to associate a new value with an existing in the . If the does not exist in the map, a is thrown. If the exists, the associated value is updated, and the key's version number is incremented. If the is not associated with a value, its version number is incremented, and the Count property is increased by one.
Insert.exception: Thrown if the specified does not exist in the .
Insert.returns: The updated with an incremented version number.

Remove.summary: Removes the value associated with the specified from the .
Remove.param: The associated with the value to be removed.
Remove.remarks: Use this method to remove the value associated with the given from the . If the specified is not found in the map, a is thrown. After removal, the slot corresponding to the is marked as free for future use.
Remove.exception: Thrown if the is not found in the map.

Reserve.summary: Increases the capacity of the by a specified amount.
Reserve.param: The additional capacity to reserve. Must be a positive integer.
Reserve.remarks: Use this method to increase the capacity of the by the specified . It ensures that the can hold at least the current count of elements plus the additional capacity without resizing frequently.

Resize.summary: Resizes the internal storage of the to the specified new size.
Resize.param: The new size to which the internal storage should be resized. Must be greater than or equal to the current capacity.
Resize.remarks: Use this method to adjust the size of the internal storage of the if needed. The parameter should be greater than or equal to the current capacity of the . If the is equal to the current capacity, no resizing occurs, and the method returns immediately.
Resize.exception: Thrown if is less than the current capacity.

Retain.summary: Retains elements in the based on a specified condition defined by a predicate function.
Retain.param: A delegate that defines the condition for retaining elements. The delegate is called for each entry with its and associated value as arguments.
Retain.remarks: The Retain method iterates through all elements in the and retains those elements for which the provided predicate function returns . Elements that do not satisfy the condition defined by the predicate are removed from the .

TryAdd.summary: Tries to add or update an element in the with the specified key and value.
TryAdd.param: The key to associate with the value.
The value to add or update in the .
When the method succeeds, this parameter receives the new or updated key associated with the value.
TryAdd.remarks: Use this method to add a new element to the with the specified and . If the element with the same key already exists, it updates the value associated with that key.
TryAdd.returns: if the element was added or updated successfully; otherwise, .

TryGet.summary: Tries to retrieve the value associated with the specified from the .
TryGet.param: The key whose associated value is to be retrieved.
When this method returns, contains the value associated with the specified , if the key is found; otherwise, the default value for .
TryGet.remarks: Use this method to check if the exists in the . If the is found, the associated value is stored in the parameter, and the method returns to indicate success. If the is not found, the parameter is set to the default value for , and the method returns to indicate that the key does not exist in the .
TryGet.returns: if the is found in the ; otherwise, .

TryRemove.summary: Attempts to remove the value associated with the specified from the .
TryRemove.param: When this method returns, contains the value associated with the specified , if found; otherwise, the default value for .
TryRemove.remarks: The TryRemove method attempts to remove the value associated with the specified from the . If the is not found in the map, this method sets the parameter to the default value of and returns . If the is found, it returns , and the associated value is stored in the parameter.
TryRemove.returns: if the was found and the associated value was successfully removed; otherwise, .

Enumerator.summary: Represents an enumerator for the collection.

remarks.para: The Enumerator struct provides an enumerator for iterating through the elements of the collection. It allows sequential access to the key-value pairs within the map.
You can use this enumerator to iterate through the elements in the using a foreach loop.

SlotKeyCollection.summary: Represents a collection of instances associated with a .
SlotKeyCollection.remarks: The /c> class provides a collection of instances that are associated with a . This collection allows you to enumerate and work with the keys present in the .

SKCCtor.summary: Initializes a new instance of the /c> class with a reference to the parent .
SKCCtor.param: The to which this collection is associated.
SKCCtor.remarks: Use this constructor to create a new /c> that is associated with a specific . The parameter represents the parent to which this collection is linked.

SKCCount.summary: Gets the number of elements in the /c>.
SKCCount.remarks: This count corresponds to the number of keys associated with the that this collection belongs to.

SKCContains.summary: Determines whether the /c> contains a specific .
SKCContains.param: The to locate in the collection.
SKCContains.remarks: Use this method to check whether the /c> contains a specific instance.
SKCContains.returns: if the /c> contains the specified ; otherwise, .

SKCCopyTo.summary: Copies the elements of the /c> to an array, starting at the specified index.
SKCCopyTo.param: The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the /c>. Must not be null.
The zero-based index in at which copying begins.
SKCCopyTo.remarks: The CopyTo method copies the elements of the /c> to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index in the destination array. The destination array must have enough space to accommodate the elements to be copied.
SKCCopyTo.exception: Thrown if is negative, greater than or equal to the length of , or if there are not enough elements in the /c> to fill the destination array starting at the specified index.

SKCEnumerator.remarks: The Enumerator struct allows you to enumerate the instances in the . Use this enumerator to iterate over the keys in the collection.

SlotValueCollection.summary: Represents a collection of values associated with a .
SlotValueCollection.remarks: The /c> class provides a collection of values that are associated with a . This collection allows you to enumerate and work with the values present in the .

SVCCtor.summary: Initializes a new instance of the /c> class associated with a .
SVCCtor.param: The with which this collection is associated. Must not be null.
SVCCtor.remarks: The constructor initializes a new instance of the /c> class that is associated with a specific . The parameter determines the with which this collection is associated.

SVCCount.summary: Gets the number of values in the /c>.
SVCCount.remarks: This count corresponds to the number of values associated with the that this collection belongs to.

SVCContains.summary: Determines whether the /c> contains a specific value.
SVCContains.param: The value to locate in the collection.
SVCContains.remarks: Use this method to check whether the /c> contains a specific value.
SVCContains.returns: if the /c> contains the specified value; otherwise, .

SVCCopyTo.summary: Copies the elements of the /c> to an array, starting at the specified index.
SVCCopyTo.param: The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the /c>. Must not be null.
The zero-based index in at which copying begins.
SVCCopyTo.remarks: The CopyTo method copies the elements of the /c> to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index in the destination array. The destination array must have enough space to accommodate the elements to be copied.
SVCCopyTo.exception: Thrown if is negative, greater than or equal to the length of , or if there are not enough elements in the /c> to fill the destination array starting at the specified index.

SVCEnumerator.summary: Represents an enumerator for the values in the /c>.
SVCEnumerator.remarks: The Enumerator struct allows you to enumerate the values stored in the . Use this enumerator to iterate over the values in the collection.
